title: Château Rouget 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Dry tannins give this wine its structure and shape, with flavors of licorice and dark chocolate. Its black plum fruits will need to balance with this firmer structure. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Martinat 2015  Côtes de Bourg
description: Structured and still firm, this is a dense wine from the Donze family estate. It has firm tannins over the rich, juicy black fruits that are generous and reflect the vintage. This wine is still young, so wait and drink from 2020.

title: Château Moulin de Blanchon 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This structured, dense wine has impressive richness. With black fruits, rich tannins and a dusty texture, it is concentrated and sure to age well. The wine comes from a 60-acre estate in the north of the Haut-Médoc, Drink from 2023.

title: Château Tour de Pressac 2015  Saint-Émilion
description: The 18 months in wood has enhanced the already succulent, exuberant black fruits of this wine. Black-coffee flavors combine with dense tannins and black-plum flavors to produce a superrich, big-hearted wine. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Tour du Haut-Moulin 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: The 30% new wood in this wine from Lionel Poitou (5th generation) shows in the minty flavors. They balance with the ripe black-currant fruits to produce a wine that will benefit from aging. Juicy, dense and smoky, it's a ripe wine that will be ready from 2023.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Crown Block Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Hints of mint and cedar in the aroma lead to full ripe fruit flavors like black cherry and blueberry in this Merlot-based Bordeaux-style blend. It has full body and moderate tannins that give just enough heft and grip on the palate.

title: DeMorgenzon 2015 Maestro Red (Stellenbosch)
description: A traditional Bordeaux-style blend of 42% Cabernet Sauvignon, 29% Merlot, 15% Malbec, 10% Petit Verdot and 4% Cabernet Franc, this is jammy and spicy upfront, boasting assertive fruit notes of boysenberry, mulberry and black plum that are hit by spicy tones of cigar box, leather and allspice. Medium in weight, it offers firm tannins that are partnered with ample acidity, lending lift to the close. Drink now–2021.

title: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Les Élements Muscat (Alsace)
description: A perfumed nose of honeysuckle and lemon has just a touch of earthiness about it. The palate is translucent, rounded but light, carrying intense notes of lemon edged by floral perfume. The finish is wonderfully dry.

title: Domaine Charles Frey 2016 Fruité Croquant Muscat (Alsace)
description: Lemon, honeysuckle, lime and rose petal aromas unite into a perfumed, appealing nose. The light palate adds a fruity dollop of ripe, yellow plum to these flavors and boosts them with creamy richness. This is a rounded but still dry and fresh Muscat with a wonderfully lasting echo.

title: Château de la Rivière 2017 Barrel Sample  (Fronsac)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Big, firm tannins add structure to rich fruit, this is dark and concentrated with hints of bitter chocolate and juicy acidity. This wine will age well, drink from 2022.

title: Château d'Hanteillan 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Soft and fruity, this wine is already showing well. It has swathes of blackberry fruits, ripe tannins and plenty of spice at the end. It is fruity, crisp and will be ready to drink from 2021.

title: Château du Cartillon 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. While this wine has plenty of tannins, it is the fruit that is so good here. The black currant flavors of Cabernet Sauvignon dominate and give the wine an open fruitiness. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Fourcas Hosten 2017 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. With more Cabernet Sauvignon than in the usual blend, this is a rich, cassis-flavored wine. It is finely structured, with a light touch and fine acidity at the end. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Cantenac Brown 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine has tight black-fruit flavors with some stalky acidity on the palate. It is a bright, fruity style, backed by fine tannins and a fresh black-currant character on the finish. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Daugay 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine is juicy and fruity, with attractive black-currant flavor. It has a crisp character as well as bright acidity, with fine fruitiness at the end. Drink from 2021.

title: Alexana 2015 East Blocks Volcanic Soils Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A dark potent wine, this blends smoky black-cherry fruit with a streak of cola and a generous helping of brown spices. The chewy finish has a nice lick of minerality which keeps it aloft.

title: Alexana 2015 Revana Vineyard Single Clone Pommard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Pommard clone wines are generally fruit-forward, as shown here, with a pleasing array of red and blue berries and fruit. Tangy acids prop up the focused core and lead into a tight finish dotted with baking spices.

title: Amalie Robert 2013 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The ripest of the winery's 2013 Pinots, this rounds out the fruit with pretty raspberry and cherry flavors. Light touches of oranges and chocolate are also evident, and the overall balance, length and elegance are fine. Just two barrels were produced, one new and one neutral.

title: Anam Cara 2015 Heather's Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This cuvée aims, the winery explains, for the most elegant expression of the estate vineyard. It succeeds, with minimal barrel influence (50% once-filled) around pretty flavors of raspberries and citrus. Finishing details bring up lemon rind, pineapple and a touch of cola.

title: Anam Cara 2015 Nicholas Vineyard Dry Gewürztraminer (Chehalem Mountains)
description: High acid yet tilting toward off dry with 13 g/l residual sugar, this shows the spicy side of the grape, rather than dousing the drinker in perfume. It plays out broadly peachy across the palate, dotted with hints of powdered sugar, ginger and melon.

title: Argyle 2014 Grower Series Vintage Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)
description: Production continues to climb on this widely available well-priced Oregon sparkling wine. A tawny straw color, it's vibrant and fresh, with yeasty dough accents around pear fruit. The balance and concentration suggest it may be cellared for up to a decade, but it's drinking quite well right now.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2015 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: Not one of the biggest or boldest versions, this earthy wine is medium to full bodied and firmly tannic, offering untamed aromas and flavors of earth, barnyard, beef and wild blackberry. It's funky in a good way, very interesting to taste and has good balance, too.

title: Bellavista 2012 Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Pressed wild flower, ripe yellow stone fruit and brioche aromas abound on this lively sparkler. The vibrant palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, tangerine zest and bitter almond alongside tangy acidity. A vivacious perlage provides the backdrop.

title: Castello di Bolgheri 2015 Varvàra  (Bolgheri)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Petit Verdot, this has aromas that recall black-skinned berry, violet, leather and tilled soil. The concentrated, balanced palate doles out black currant, tobacco, licorice and a touch of tar framed in polished tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

title: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Sélection Muscat (Alsace)
description: A wonderfully subtle nose hints at rose and honeysuckle blossom. The palate is completely dry, light in nature and offers floral flavors brightened by lemon freshness. This combines wonderful, dry lightness with subtlety.

title: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Vieilles Vignes Chasselas (Alsace)
description: A touch of earthiness and lemon pith play on the quiet nose. The palate is fresh in feel, with an intriguing touch of herbal bitterness. Concentrated and intense, this remains taut nonetheless.

title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2015 Zind White (Alsace)
description: Lemon and earth aromas on the nose lead onto a dry and gently pear-fruited palate. There is an element of softness, a creamy touch radiating from a ripe, concentrated core of subdued Mirabelle and pear fruit. The finish is rich, resonant and dry.

title: Estrin 2013 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)
description: Coming mostly from esteemed Riverbend Vineyard, this wine saw just 10% new French oak, putting the focus on the fruit. High-toned aromas of dried flower, herb, cherry, vanilla and dried cranberry lead to a full, flavorful palate packed to the brim with dark fruit. Cranberry flavors linger on the finish.

title: Ferghettina NV Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Enticing aromas of pressed wild flower, chamomile and white stone fruit lead the nose. The bright palate delivers ripe yellow apple, white peach and dried herb alongside an elegant, lively perlage. A lemon-drop note gives it a tangy finish.

title: Flowers 2015 Camp Meeting Ridge Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: With a backbone of well-defined acidity, this coastal white is creamy in texture, with highlights of fig, pear and toasted oak. Juicy and likable, it lingers in a vanilla wafer tone.
